description.narrative: The project has targeted good governance by training 100 members from targeted coops (90 women and 10 men) on designing and conducting advocacy campaigns. In addition, 10 women members in Anabta Cooperative for Consuming were trained in quality control in making and preserving “makdous”, which is a product they already produce and sell at a rate of 400kgs every week. The training was to ensure a consistent quality along every step of the production. 180 members participated in 6 exchange visits between coops and selected coops participated in 4 national expos to market their products and network with relevant stakeholders and other coops. 230 coop members and citizens in general engaged in drama sketches that handled the importance of collective decision and policy-making at coops. Furthermore, the project supported 5 coops in tools and equipment that improve services or products already provided/ delivered/ produced by the coops and it was clear from the beginning how they will positively contribute to the value chain and increase coop members’ satisfaction and quality of services and products.

"ARIJ will not be core supported during the bridging year 2018. A new assessment will be done in 2019.‎ The project aims at women’s increased resilience through access to land, financial and ‎production resources. The project will improve women’s capacities and opportunities to afford a ‎decent work. Expected results:‎ ‎ • Strengthened organisational capacity of ARIJ through upgrading their M&E systems, bylaws ‎ ‎• Good governance practices enhanced (for cooperatives and CBO) through model of ‎applying good governance within coops is promoted ‎ ‎• Improving relevance and feasibility of cooperative services ‎ ‎• Improved service delivery where coops/CBO provide relevant and feasible services to their ‎members and communities.‎ • Enhanced institutional framework through advocating the needs of the Palestinian coops ‎ ‎• Women participate in decision-making and income generating initiatives through‎ increasing women’s knowledge of practices to overcome restrictions on pursuing commercial or ‎economic activities • Promoting and advocating for women’s rights and gender equality through advocacy campaign."

activity-date.narrative: Planned end date of the activity
Planned start date of the activity
